sequence:
Centaur and the Port "Elders"

<size=45>Chapter 7 - True Equals</size>

scripts.say: Centaur spoke of the "new meaning" of "Elder."
It has been some time since I first joined the fleet.
In that time, I've grown closer to my Elders, and seen past the walls they put up on the battlefield.
I know now they are people, just like me. They have sadness and they have joy, they have their likes and their dislikes.

options.content: Explain to her that's completely normal.

scripts.say: Like you, Commander, you have those times when you just can't take work anymore and you doze off on your desk.
Yes, it's completely normal. Just as everyone has their own opinions, and from time to time that leads to conflict...
But in service of our collective goals, we work together, we help each other. That's the fleet I always dreamt of.

options.content: Ask her if that includes her Commander...

scripts.say: And now I'm a part of that fleet too... so no longer do I merely respect everyone, now I truly love everyone.
C- Commander... of course, I love you too...
What I'm getting at is, in the beginning, I called everyone "Elder" because I respected their service in the Great War.
But now, because I so love and cherish fighting alongside them in the name of peace, that's why I call them Elder.
Ahahaha, and I'm a little embarrassed to say it, but the main reason is I just got used to calling everyone that!
It was so complicated, and yet so simple...
I'm doing all the talking here. Now it's your turn, Commander.
I mean, I've been your secretary ship for this long. It's only natural I've gotten to know you very well.
But I'd still like to hear some of it straight from the horse's mouth. Tell me a secret, Commander. Tell me something you've never told anyone.
Hehe, won't you tell me more... about you? Commander...? ... Oh Elder One...?
